content: I have added RDF support to the fhir.net api. Vonk (Furore's FHIR server) can then use that version to also support RDF. My problem is that my used RDF library is not .Net Core. Who knows of a good RDF API in .Net Core? Thanks.
hey @Eric Prud'hommeaux @David Booth @Harold Solbrig where are we up to with RDF?

I think @Harold Solbrig has been making the most progress lately. He has a nice demo of using FHIR RDF with SNOMED CT, which he is scheduled to present on a Yosemite Project webinar next week Thursday Oct 12: http://yosemiteproject.org/recorded-webinars/2017-2/fhir-rdf-as-a-bridge-to-the-semantic-web-in-healthcare/ . @Michael van der Zel is also working with @Ewout Kramer to get his .Net RDF implementation included in the main .Net release, but last I heard had not made much more progress. Michael and I did get it running on Linux though, when we were in Madrid, using Mono.
